animal exer 18 dr harvey treating eye bird hath obſervation eye bird ſaith never contract themſelves proportion eye head viviparous animal hen bird take skin covering eye ſhall find either leaſt equal whole bulk brain woodcock like either eye greater reſt head ſetting aſide bill general orbit cavity containing eye bird exceeds brain ſelf may ſeen skull eye indeed outwardly appear ſmall becauſe aurita eared owl yet hath ear properly ſo called feather ſticking ſide head ſomewhat reſembling ear horn therefore called alſo hornowl ſuppoſe feather encompaſſing earholes bird ſupply defect exterior upon haunt partridge ſhall know eagerneſs hunting kind whimpering whining greatly deſirous open fear daring ſhall warn take heed ſaying wiſe like notwithſtanding either ruſh ſo ſpring elſe open uſe hath breaſt belly moſt part white head crown ſpeckled white ſpots neck back tail brown quillfeathers wing black alſo covert yellowiſh ſides leg foot ſlender black bill indifferently long ſharppointed luſcinia ſeu philomela 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 graecis nightingale chief ſinging bird bigneſs goldfinch redſtard longbodied ounce weight billpoint tailend ſeven inch long extremity wing extended ten ave primùm tanta vox tam parvo corpuſculo tam pertinax ſpiritus deinde una perfecta muſicae ſcientia modulatus editur ſonus et nunc continuo ſpiritu trahitur longum nunc variatur inflexo nunc breviterque omnia tam parvulis faucibus quae tot exquiſitis tibiarum tormentis ar hominum excogitavit ut non ſit dubium hanc ſuavitatem praemonſtratam ac nè quis dubitet artis eſſe plures ſingulis among choiceſt dainty apitius moſt profound gulph gluttony riot pliny relates wrote phoenicopters tongue excellent taſte relliſh chap ii trochilus commonly called corrira lib 19 cap 55 aldrov bird hath long leg yea longeſt wholefooted miſtaken flammant hath longer fowl except avoſetta wherefore becauſe run ſwiftly call corrira courier whence conjecture trochilus write run along ſhores celerity rather preſent heat uſe judgment melt waſte glut fatneſs empty evacuate thoſe gorgitive ſtuffing humour ſo inſeam make clean omit becauſe ſaid think main uſe ſtones aſſiſt ſtomach comminution grinding meat thereby cauſing ſpeedy perfect concoction ſo conduce much preſervation recovery health ſtomachs performing office well foundation original moſt diſeaſes hawk animal ſith error firſt concoction amended ſubſequent one remarkable obſervation hath may ſeem argue ſtones purgative quality upon giving ſtones forbearance hawk oftentimes beginning caſt ſtones midſt end guſh abundance wateriſh yellowiſh greaſie ſlime glut forth body though ſhe caſting daily flowed forth adviſe beginning make hawk perfectly clean ſo keep without pampering great meal empty good ſtomach ſhe fly ſhe flown full may endanger life beſides ſhe never fly regard attention keeper ſtomach perfect proof whereof take young hawk neſt though newly diſcloſed breed familiarly deviſe yet ſhall come afterwards fly ſhe muſt altogether governed ſtomach let fail never ſo little every puff wind blow nay wind ſtirring yet ſhe wheel ſink away voice time lured trained contrariwiſe hap find ſhe hungry though ſhe would ſtarve ſhe would prey ſelf yet ſhe man nay ſhe ready take cap ſhe either leave loſe note well ſhew cleanneſs ſoever find hawk caſting mute otherwiſe although taken never ſo much pain caſting clean feed ſtones purge cleanſe inwardly yet ſhe perfectly inſeamed till ſhe come exerciſe wing labour body ſhe break greaſe degree inſeam throughly ſure labour firſt immoderate ingender grief alſo muſt give liberty degree ſtir wing uſe body may heat exceſſively taken ſhe throughly inſeamed ſhe may weary flying ſhe never take harm § xi alter ſome ill quality condition falcon ſhall ſometimes meet hawk well lured given good content deviſe yet upon leaſt ſcope liberty ſhall offered ſhe tarry go way reclaim ſo bad condition muſt take courſe abate pride ſomewhat yet reaſon reſpect weather get makehawk reclaim ill quality muſt take courſe though call draw along chirping whiſtle thick covert place yet take fiſt fully ſatisfied let ſtill wait till come ſome plain place entertain fiſt let feed little thereon put leaſh let eat reſt ground cloſe reſerved ſome ſtump take fiſt remember ſometimes ſtoop gently knee quietly ſoftly convey ſome bit unſeen afar ſhe ſtrike hand talon c thus daily gentle uſage ſo long call embolden make ſo familiar never offer carry thing ſhe kill ſure get gently provided meal ready dreſt ſhe ſits partridge beſtow ſame bit cleanly conveyance prolong time pluming ſtay ſharpneſs appetite deſire feed ſhe muſt would cauſe love bird better ſelf loth afterwards time bereaved thereby take occaſion carry hoping enjoy ſelf quietly ſecretly whereas courſe ſo pleaſe draw love ſo certainly ſhe never offer carry one feather give bloud ſome reverſion take fiſt mean ſhe never break prey ſo long one feather left ſpeak experience credit ſtill attend coming reward hand well ſtomach c like manner teach enter hawk rook heron wild gooſe mew c trainrook two c deſires particularly informed may conſult author § ix certain obſervations oſtreger keeping goſhawk goſhawk good ſoarage many time prof worſe mewing becauſe ſoarage ſhe cheriſhed make take delight flight chief skill oſtreger conſiſts coying cheriſhing hawk ſo ſhe may take pride flight wherefore good firſt entring always trainpartridge bag ſerve withal need ſo win love ply hawk tiring plumage morning evening open head caſt moiſt humour wherewith goſhawks naturally troubled let tiring rump beef pinion wing chicken leg given fire warm sun open head keep exerciſe give every night caſting either feather cotton morning mark whether wrought round whether ſweet whether moiſt dry colour water drop thereby may judge caſe hawk muſt alſo regard mewts whether clean winter cold weather ſet hawk warm ſome place fire made roll pearch cotton ſome ſuch like thing set pearch far wall hawk hurt feather ſhe bateth cold ſet every morning ſome place sun hath power hour two let hen poultry come near place hawk ſhall pearch spring offer hawk water every week elſe ſhe ſoar away ſhe fleeth make ſeek time ſhe bathe accord flight winter go preſently next houſe weather fire back gorge would make ſick likewiſe dry carried rain keep luſty high yet ſtomach ſo ſharp ſhe may fly eagerly plucking hawk mar make cowardly liable ſickneſs infirmity keep hawk clean feather whole feather broken bruiſed imp preſently firſt year beſt fly goſhawk field covert ſo learn hold turn tail midſt flight mewed hawk may make better let littleramage overmanned feeding beſt hot meat would breed kill great fowl make train thereof would continue thoſe flight never fly leſs take ſpoil would make fly dog aſſiſt feed great fowl dog fleſh tied wing train hawk reward upon train dog make acquainted together thus continue till dog throughly know duty ſure keep dog tied let go looſe ſpoil beſt dog never give reward make ſuch fowl reſcue hawk chap x sparrowhawk sparhawk ſaith latham though demycreature yet ſpirit mettle worthy march beſt company nay better hawk ſhe ſhe kept ſhe ought luſty ſtrong beſides know man reclaim fly sparrowhawk may eaſily know keep deal hawk herein lieth excellency sparrowhawk ſhe ſerves winter summer great pleaſure fly kind game falcon winter sparrowhawk prove good ſhe kill pie chough jay daintieſt meat unleſs time reſt alſo well waſht dried eſpecially ſhe mewd againſt ſhe fly ſhe muſt prepared ſhort cut put perfect edge upon ſhe fly beſt manner alſo ſhe ſhould flown morning unleſs ſhe prepared night ſhort clean ſupper purpoſe likewiſe ought always little box full freſh butter mixt little saffron sugarcandy give meat let eat box ſhe great delight keep head evermore looſe good temper alſo prevent cray keep proud full ſpirit eyas nyas sparrowhawk greateſt difficulty bring perfection muſt firſt feed ſome cool room hath two window one north eaſt muſt open barred lath ſo wide hawk get vermine come strow chamber freſh leaf every reſpect room ordered mewing falcon muſt feed eyas sparrow young pigeon sheep heart whilſt ſhe young little ſhould cut meat ſhred ſmall pellet feed twice thrice aday according find endew put ſhe full ſummed flieth give whole ſmall bird ſometimes feed fiſt ſuffering ſtrain kill bird hand ſometimes put live bird chamber ſhe ſhe may learn foot kill let feed upon preſence courſe neal take ſcurvy quality hiding prey ſhe hath ſeiſed natural property belonging eyaſſes likewiſe every morning go room call fiſt whiſtle uſe ſuch term would hereafter acquainted ſhe hath put forth feather full ſummed take chamber furniſh bell bewets jeſſes line altogether requiſite ſeel firſt ſhe may better endure hood handling let rufterhood large eaſie muſt pull care hurt web put needle eyelid drawing end thread together tie beak ſtreight knot cut thread near end knot ſo twiſt together eyelid may raiſed ſo upwards hawk may ſee thread ſhall ſlacken ſhe ſhall able ſee backwards cauſe thread put nearer beak eyas well hood fiſt let kill ſmall bird thereon call two three day longer till ſhe come far take live pigeon tied foot creance ſtir till hawk bate ſeiſe flat place fly neſts firſt make clean ſcraping dirt old root hole putting freſh graſs lundes make neſts field taken ſaid skrabe ſuch thoſe many ſtones let run unto ſome little dog ſo taught bring bird hundred egg according place large three finger breadth one another bird fly away egg rowl often sea laying one egg ſhe ſitteth ſtreight thereon continueth ſo month time never ſtirring place till young one hatcht mean time cock bringeth eat lay manner ſitting cloſe one another bird bird place ſo cliff ſeemeth quite black young one hatchd ſhe remains yet three week taketh back carrieth sea fowler cometh place often men hapneth ſometimes old leave young one therefore taken hand many killed grown wild reaſon men continual hunting fly away young one running together flock hen cometh ſhe ſeeks ſame place ſhe ſate clacketh ſo long till young one cometh well able diſcern dam though ſhaped alike ſhe giveth young eat ſhe putteth head back wing giving ſo eat backwards daw hoiers alka awk whence gueſs author daw razorbill miſtaken name hatcheth young one hole chink high promontory hoier miſtaken name bird conclude becauſe called ſame name viz auk north england ſo manifeſt either northern men borrowed ferroeſe ferroeſe unlikely chance ſhould impoſe ſame name upon borrowed name ferroeſe ſeems probable becauſe part england farther diſtant ferroyer iſlands bird called name yet poſſibly may alſo called daw thoſe iſlands either guillem cornwall ſhould call daw cannot imagine unleſs bigneſs colour back cannot expreſt pain danger take theſe bird thoſe high ſteep cliff whereof many two hundred fathom high men apt nature fit work called fowler take uſually two manner either climb theſe high promontory ſteep wall let themſelves thick ſtrong hemprope climb pole five ſix ell long iron hook end boat clift faſten unto man girdle another rope fowler hath helping thus higheſt place get footing afterwards alſo help another man ſo ſeveral come every one fowling staff hand long rope tied others waſte climb ſo high poſſibly find difficulty help thruſting one another breech pole firſt hath taken footing draweth rope faſtned waſte ſo proceed till come place bird build going hill pleaſe many dangerous place climb bound themſelves rope end one ſeeketh convenient place ſtand ſure hold himſelf faſt whilſt goeth theſe dangerous place happen chanceth fall ſtands firm keep help paſſeth ſafe likewiſe faſtneth himſelf till hath paſſed dangerous place ſo go clifts bird pleaſe though often hapneth pitty one doth ſtand faſt ſtrong enough hold fall fall kill themſelves manner ſome periſh every year mr peter clauſon deſcription norway writeth anciently law country whoſoever climbed ſo clifts fell died body found buried next kinſman ſhould go ſame way durſt could dead buried sanctified earth one full temerity bane found nothing law adays come manner aforeſaid bird within clifts ſeldom come bird ſo tame take hand hardly leave young one wild either caſt net clift againſt thoſe either fly thence thereunto oppoſe fowling staff net intangle therein manner take great multitude lumwiſves daw lundes mean time lieth boat beneath sea wherein caſt bird killed manner ſhort time fill boat fowl pretty fair weather good fowling fowler ſtay clifts ſeven eight day together hole rock ſafely reſt meat let line top mountain mean time ſome go every day fetch home taken rock ſo difficult manner get unto wherefore ſeek come thereunto call sie ſecond manner purſue bird performed manner rope eighty hundred fathom long three finger thick fowler maketh end thereof faſt waſte leg ſo ſit thereon thus let fowling staff hand ſix men hold rope let eaſily laying piece wood brink rock upon rope glideth may worn piece hard rough edge ſtone beſides another ſmall line faſtned fowler body pulleth give notice ſhould let great rope either lower higher hold ſtill may ſtay place whereunto come man great danger becauſe stone looſened clift ſwinging rope often fall upon head cannot avoid wherefore hath uſually head sea man cap thick ſhaggy defend ſome meaſure blow stone big otherwiſe coſteth life put nevertheleſs themſelves continually danger wretched body food ſake hoping god mercy protection unto moſt part alſo devoutly recommend themſelves go work otherwiſe ſay great danger ſelf toilſom artificial labour hath learned ſo let uſed thereunto turned rope ſo groweth giddy troubled head nothing hath learned art taketh ſport knowing ſwing himſelf rope ſet foot againſt rock caſting himſelf ſome fathom thence whence ſhooteth himſelf place knoweth bird knoweth alſo ſit line air hold fowling staff hand taking bird come fly away hole rock ſtretcheth ſelf making underneath ſieling bird knoweth skilfully greateſt art ſhoot himſelf great way clift ſwiftly ſwing himſelf roof take footing making himſelf theſe hole looſe great rope faſtens ſtone rock may ſlip outſide clift goeth rock taking fowl either hand fowling staff according manner aforeſaid hath killed many bird thinketh fit tie bundle faſtneth little rope giving ſign pulling ſhould draw working thus whole day get ſitteth upon great rope giving new ſign ſhould pull elſe worketh himſelf climbing along rope girdle full bird alſo uſual folk enough hold great rope fowler driveth poſt ſloaping earth maketh rope faſt thereunto letting ſo himſelf without body help work manner aforeſaid ſome rock ſo formed one go land taketh comrade proceeding manner aforeſaid taking much fowl girdle waſte hold much carry bundle back carrying manner home alſo ſome place high ſteep clifts land ariſe hundred fathom sea almoſt bad come unto rock whereunto help alſo one another aforeſaid manner taking ſtrong rope faſten clift let hang whole summer nimbly climb take fowl pleaſe theſe manner terrible dangerous ſee deſcribe ſpecially one conſiders ſteepneſs height rock ſeeming poſſible man could come much leſs climb let go alſo ſome place faſten end toe finger ſhunning ſuch place though hundred fathom height sea dear meat theſe poor people muſt venture life ſo extremely many long venturing laſt periſh therein fowl brought home part thereof eaten freſh another part much taken hung dry winter proviſion feather gathered make merchandize expences inhabitant get great many thoſe fowl god giveth bleſſing fit weather yet every land iſlands lie towards sea great promontory northern iſlands myggyneſs waagoe skuo diemens suderoe dark weather take moſt bird ſtay rock clear weather hot sunſhine ſeek sea againſt flying away keep themſelves moſt ſitting clifts towards sea ſide people go alſo ſometimes boat take fowling stave
